text: Victor Plarr Plarr's Lives of the Fellows is a biographical register of the fellows of the Royal College of Surgeons of England that contains over 9,000 obituaries.Plarr's Lives of the Fellows Online. Royal College of Surgeons. Retrieved 22 February 2018.Plarr's Lives of the Fellows. Sarah Gillam, Royal College of Surgeons. Retrieved 22 February 2018.' The first printed volumes of the work were produced by Victor Plarr (1863-1929), who was the College's librarian from 1897 until his death, and published posthumously in 1930. The last of the nine printed volumes was published in 2005 and profiled all the fellows (FRCS) known to have died between the establishment of the College in 1843 and 2002. Since 2006, Plarr's has been published online and continues to be updated with new entries monthly. == References == == External links == Category:Biographical dictionaries
title: Plarr's Lives of the Fellows
